author: Special Correspondent
text:
Despite the police warning parents not to allow their under-aged children to drive vehicles, the trend continues unabated.

The latest victims are two 16-year-olds who died after their motorcycle was hit by a lorry on the Puzhal-Madhuravoyal by-pass road on Saturday morning. Another teenager is battling for life at Stanley Medical College hospital.

According to officials, Tamil Selvan (16), Saran (16) and Sushin (16) were studying in class X at a private school in Madhavaram, where the three live. On Saturday morning, they decided to pay their friend a visit.

“Tamil Selvan took his father Umapathy’s motorcycle and picked up the other two. When they on a flyover, a lorry came from behind and hit their vehicle. Tamil Selvan and Saran died on the spot and Sushin was rushed to Stanley Medical College hospital for treatment,” said a police officer attached to the Madhavaram police station.

The police have seized the lorry. The driver is however absconding. “We are trying to locate him,” said the police officer. “The road is dangerous due to lorry traffic and fast-moving vehicles. At least three accidents take place every week,” added the officer.

“They cannot handle such a vehicle,” said a senior police officer. According to Provision 1 in Section 4 of the Motor Vehicles Act, “no one under the age of 18 years can drive a motor vehicle unless the engine capacity is not exceeding 50 cc and the driver is 16 years of age.” “We can only create awareness and take action against those who flout the law. Parents and schools have an equal role to play in preventing schoolchildren from riding motorcycles,” said an officer.
title: Underage bikers killed by lorry
